description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1mf6p","text":"Modified version of PacBio's MAS-seq protocol for snASE samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"anock","text":"1 Bring the Qubit 1X dsDNA HS working solution and standards to room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c4oq1","text":"2 Pulse vortex or pipette mix each sample to homogenize the DNA in solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"497dd","text":"3 Quick spin each sample to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b3vvn","text":"4 Take a 1 μL aliquot from each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dss36","text":"5 Measure DNA concentration with a Qubit fluorometer using the 1X dsDNA HS kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0m51","text":"6 Dilute each sample to 1.0-1.5 ng/μL in elution buffer or water, based on the Qubit reading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ege","text":"7 MeasureDNA size distribution with a Bioanalyzer system using the High Sensitivity DNA Kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5o5k","text":"8 Proceed to the next step of the protocol if sample quality is acceptable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6hp9i","text":"Prepare PCR mix per sample: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9mfb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b931","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Component","Volume"],["Nuclease-free water","Make up volume"],["MAS PCR mix ","25 µL"],["MAS 5’ capture primer mix","10 µL"],["10x 3’ cDNA library","Up to 15 µL"],["Total Volume","50 µL"]],"guid":"AB237687F9BD4B558973D8A4AB429511","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Component","Volume"],["Nuclease-free water","Make up volume"],["MAS PCR mix ","25 µL"],["MAS 5’ capture primer mix","10 µL"],["10x 3’ cDNA library","Up to 15 µL"],["Total Volume","50 µL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4av4a","text":" Pipette-mix RM1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4fkjc","text":" Quick spin RM1 in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2s2rn","text":" Select the TSO PCR program based on cDNA input.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a45t3","text":" Cleanup with 1.5X SMRTbell cleanup beads","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ut2a","text":"Add 1.5X v/v (75 μL) of resuspended, room-temperature SMRTbell cleanup beads to each tube of amplified cDNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3dprs","text":" Pipette mix the beads until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"32ebt","text":" Quick spin the tube strip in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eu178","text":"Leave at room temperature for 10 minutes to allow DNA to bind beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dibn7","text":"Place tube strip in a magnetic separation rack until beads separate fully from the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"57h7t","text":"Slowly pipette off the cleared supernatant without disturbing the beads. Discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8od9a","text":"Slowly dispense 200 µL, or enough to cover the beads, of freshly prepared 80% ethanol into each tube. After 30 seconds, pipette off the 80% ethanol and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"55b6r","text":"Repeat the previous step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6950","text":"Remove residual 80% ethanol: • Remove tube strip from the magnetic separation rack. • Quick spin tube strip in a microcentrifuge. • Place tube strip back in a magnetic separation rack until beads separate fully from the solution. • Pipette off residual 80% ethanol and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21dt9","text":"Remove tube strip from the magnetic rack. Immediately add 42 µL of elution buffer to each tube and resuspend the beads by pipetting 10 times or until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"16hv1","text":"Quick spin the tube strip in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cm3oa","text":"Leave at room temperature for 5 minutes to elute DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aq7kr","text":"Place tube strip in a magnetic separation rack until beads separate fully from the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1n77f","text":"Slowly pipette off the cleared supernatant without disturbing the beads. Transfer supernatant to a new tube strip. Discard old tube strip with beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7764e","text":"Recommended: Evaluate sample concentration. Take a 1 µL aliquot from each tube. Measure DNA concentration with a Qubit fluorometer using the 1x dsDNA HS kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bg55g","text":"Proceed to the next step of the protocol if sample quantity is acceptable (at least 150 ng) and not exceeding 1 μg. If the sample quantity is higher than 1 μg, only carry forward to Step 3 with a maximum input of 1 μg","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5mmj","text":"Bring MAS capture beads kit to room temperature. Resuspend the beads by vortexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a28fj","text":"Transfer 10 μL resuspended MAS capture beads per sample to a PCR tube. Scale up the amount of beads if processing more than 4 samples (with 10% overage). If preparing more than 40 μL of beads, use a 1.5 mL LoBind tube instead of PCR tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3ml9","text":"Place the tube on the magnet until the beads separate fully from the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5r5f","text":"Carefully remove and discard the supernatant while the tube remains on the magnet. Avoid touching the bead pellet with the pipette tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hvio","text":"Remove the tube from the magnet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nhmu","text":"Add 40 μL MAS bead binding buffer along the insidewall of the tube where the beads are collected and gently resuspend by pipetting using wide bore tips. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bent6","text":"DO NOT VORTEX.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6e93r","text":"Note: the solution may be viscous. Highly recommend using wide bore tips to avoid foaming. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3s02e","text":"When excess bubbles are present, lower cDNA recovery is expected. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ckbku","text":"Quick-spin the tube in a microcentrifuge if needed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jim6","text":"Note: Scale up the volume of MAS capture binding buffer accordingly if preparing more than 40 µL of beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2c9dq","text":"Place the tube on the magnet until the beads separate fully from the solution and remove the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bj82u","text":"Resuspendthe beads in 40 μL MAS bead binding buffer by pipetting slowly using wide bore tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j6tc","text":"DO NOT VORTEX.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bj1i","text":"Note: the solution may be viscous. Highly recommend using wide bore tips to avoid foaming.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao13u","text":"When excess bubbles are present, lower cDNA recovery is expected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98nd9","text":"Note: Scale up the volume of MAS capture binding buffer accordingly, if preparing more than 40 µL of beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"203nl","text":"Distribute 40 μLof resuspended MAScapture beads into the appropriate number of PCR tubes before proceeding to Step 3.8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ov3p","text":"Add 40 μL of a solution containing the biotinylated DNA-fragments (from Step 2.18) to the resuspended beads. Mix carefully using wide bore tips to avoid foaming of the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hg5o","text":"Incubate the tube at room temperature for 15 minutes on a rotatorto keep the beads in suspension. Quick-spin the tube in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"57ail","text":"Place the tube on the magnet until the beads separate fully from the solution and remove the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evjud","text":"Resuspend the MAS capture beads/DNA-complex in 80 μL MAS bead washing buffer by pipette mixing until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6jsam","text":"Place the tube on the magnet until the beads separate fully from the solution and remove the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dpt4u","text":"Remove the tube from the magnet. Resuspend the MAS capture beads/DNA-complex in 80 μL MAS bead washing buffer by pipette mixing until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"breqd","text":"Place the tube on the magnet until the beads separate fully from the solution and remove the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dursu","text":"Remove the tube from the magnet. Resuspend the MAS capture beads/DNA complex in 80 μL nuclease free water by pipette mixing until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dkfq7","text":"Place the tube on the magnet until the beads separate fully from the solution and remove the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdj75","text":"Resuspend the capture beads/DNA-complex in 40 µL of elution buffer by pipette mixing until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5gbs7","text":"Add 2 µL MAS enzyme to the sample with capture beads to cleave the captured DNA products from MAS capture beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56juj","text":"Pipette-mix each sample and a very quick spin in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"869pi","text":"Run the TSOartifact removal program. Heated lid set at 47°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nu2s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsn7r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6nb7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nh2v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["Step ","Time","Temperature"],["1","30 minutes","37°C"],["2","Hold","4°C"]],"guid":"617332FC76D4441095EAB96A2EA5CF6E","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Step ","Time","Temperature"],["1","30 minutes","37°C"],["2","Hold","4°C"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hgnl","text":"Place the tube on the magnet for 1 minute and move the supernatant containing the library to a fresh tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ev1uk","text":"Cleanup with 1.5X SMRTbell cleanup beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4164v","text":"Add 1.5X v/v (63 μL) of resuspended, room-temperature SMRTbell cleanup beads to each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8b56t","text":"Pipette-mix the beads until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6cavf","text":"Quick-spin the tube strip in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8aqc","text":" Leave at room temperature for 10 minutes to allow DNA to bind beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e0ss5","text":" Place tube strip in a magnetic separation rack until the beads separate fully from the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dae7m","text":" Slowly pipette off the cleared supernatant without disturbing the beads. Discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5esvg","text":"Slowly dispense 200 µL, or enough to cover the beads, of freshly prepared 80% ethanol into each tube. After 30 seconds, pipette off the 80% ethanol and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dcsjk","text":" Repeat the previous step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5sgva","text":"Remove residual 80% ethanol: • Remove the tube strip from the magnetic separation rack. • Quick-spin the tube strip in a microcentrifuge. • Place the tube strip back in a magnetic separation rack until the beads separate fully from the solution. Pipette off residual 80% ethanol and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bvagk","text":"Remove the tube strip from the magnetic rack. Immediately add 46 µL of elution buffer to each tube and resuspend the beads by pipetting 10 times or until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"87s2a","text":" Quick-spin the tube strip in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ua0p","text":"Leave at room temperature for 5 minutes to elute DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qjem","text":"Place the tube strip in a magnetic separation rack until beads separate fully from the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9s379","text":"Slowly pipette off the cleared supernatant without disturbing the beads. Transfer supernatant to a new 0.5 mL LoBind tube. Discard the old tube strip with beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9lek","text":"Recommended: Evaluate sample concentration. • Take a 1 µL aliquot from each tube. Measure DNA concentration with a Qubit fluorometer using the 1x dsDNA HS kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"85mc3","text":"Proceed to the next step of the protocol if sample quantity is acceptable (maximum 50 ng). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u3of","text":"If cDNA amount is \u003e50 ng, dilute the cDNA to 50 ng using elution buffer in a total volume of 45µL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4raha","text":"Set up the following PCR reaction mix per sample on ice.
Reaction Mix 2 (RM2):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ori8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8fed8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["145","145"],"data":[["Master mix components","Volume for 16X
concatenation*
"],["PCR Grade Water","176–X µL"],["MAS PCR mix","220 µL
"],["55 ng of amplified cDNA from
Step 67","X µL"],["Total volume","396 µL"]],"guid":"D7DE8E2FC8294521AD01D6035E9B4A51","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Master mix components","Volume for 16X
concatenation*
"],["PCR Grade Water","176–X µL"],["MAS PCR mix","220 µL
"],["55 ng of amplified cDNA from
Step 67","X µL"],["Total volume","396 µL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"46akg","text":"Quick-spin RM2 in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"35c5j","text":"Add 22.5 µL of RM2 to a new PCR tube on ice. Repeat this step to prepare a total of 16 tubes per sample (each containing 22.5 µL of RM2)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"30tjb","text":"Add 2.5 µL of MAS primers premix A-PQ into each of 16 PCR tubes on ice, with each tube getting only one primer. Tube 1= Primer mix A, Tube 2=Primer mix B,... Tube 16= Primer mix PQ. DO NOT ADD MORE THAN ONE PRIMER PREMIX TO A TUBE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0img","text":"Pipette-mix each sample. The total volume of each tube should be 25.0 µL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1fe30","text":"Quick-spin the strip tubes in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22gkj","text":"Run the MAS PCR program. Reactions can be held overnight in the cycler.\nNote: if the total sample quantity is less than 50 ng, follow the table below for cycle number.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ci0m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ajkt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4mspm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cq85a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["cDNA Input amount","Cycle Number"],["30–50 ng","9"],["12.5–29.9 ng","10"]],"guid":"F0ABBEDD3ABD4EB2B44673629E0B83F7","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["cDNA Input amount","Cycle Number"],["30–50 ng","9"],["12.5–29.9 ng","10"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7h71f","text":"Clean up with 1.5X SMRTbell cleanup beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a5fjf","text":"Pool entire volume of all 16 reactions into a single 1.5 mL LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfkr3","text":"Add 1.5X v/v (600 µL) ofresuspended, room-temperature SMRTbell cleanup beads to the PCR pool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2b8oc","text":" Pipette-mix the beads until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"biu75","text":"Quick-spin the tube strip in a microcentrifuge to collect all liquid from the sides of the tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"flmvt","text":"Leave at room temperature for 10 minutes to allow DNA to bind beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4j2pb","text":"Place 1.5mL LoBind tube in a magnetic separation rack until beads separate fully from the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"366o1","text":"Slowly pipette off the cleared supernatant without disturbing the beads. Discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3umct","text":"Slowly dispense 1 mL, or enough to cover the beads, of freshly prepared 80% ethanol into each tube. After 30 seconds, pipette off the 80% ethanol and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"34ep8","text":"Repeat the previous step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bqni","text":"Remove residual 80% ethanol: • Remove the LoBind tube from the magnetic separation rack. • Quick-spin the LoBind tube in a microcentrifuge. • Place the LoBind tube back in a magnetic separation rack until beads separate fully from the solution. Pipette off residual 80% ethanol and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dl7m9","text":"Remove the LoBind tube from the magnetic rack. Immediately add 50 µL of elution bufferto each tube and resuspend the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ajt1c","text":"Quick-spin the LoBind tube in a microcentrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8tmu1","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes to elute DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5mbb6","text":"Place the LoBind tube in a magnetic separation rack until beads separate fully from the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m846","text":"Slowly pipette off the cleared supernatant without disturbing the beads. Transfer supernatant to a new LoBind tube. Discard old tube with beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bqvl","text":"Recommended: Evaluate sample concentration. • Take a 1 µL aliquot from each tube, dilute with 9 µL of elution buffer. Using 1 µL of the dilution, measure DNA concentration with a Qubit fluorometer using the 1x dsDNA HS kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ckf62","text":" Proceed to the next step of the protocol if sample quantity is acceptable (required input: 10 µg). Do not proceed if less than 6 µg is available.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aibn7","text":"In a 0.2 mL PCR tube, add 10 µg of sample from Step 4.22, in 47 µL of volume. Dilute with elution buffer going into this step if sample is too concentrated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2pnjc","text":"Add 10 µL of MAS enzyme to create single-stranded extensions on PCR-amplified cDNA fragments to enable subsequent directional assembly of 16 PCR products.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"el8n5","text":"Pipette-mix each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fit62","text":"Run the MAS primer digestion program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5gr4i","text":"Add 3 µL of MAS adapter bc01–04 (use a single barcode per sample) and 20 µL of MAS ligation additive to each sample for a total volume of 80 µL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"agbit","text":"Pipette-mix each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

individual preps, add components directly to each sample in the order and volume listed below.

solution.
Pipette off residual 80% ethanol and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Using a wide bore pipette tip, immediately add 43 µL of elution buffer to each tube and resuspend the beads by pipetting 10 times or until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7n7dg","text":"Quick-spin the tube strip in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2unjs","text":"Run the nuclease treatment program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fseli","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"42m28","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["Step","Time","Temperature"],["1","60 Minutes","37°C"],["2","Hold","4°C"]],"guid":"E6034D8A226044F4825A174DBB984856","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Step","Time","Temperature"],["1","60 Minutes","37°C"],["2","Hold","4°C"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6l687","text":"Add 60 µL SMRTbell cleanup beads to each sample from the previous step. Using wide bore tips, pipette-mix the beads until evenly distributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afm27","text":"Quick-spin the tube strip in a microcentrifuge to collect all liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3scr8","text":"Leave at room temperature for 10 minutes to allow DNA to bind beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ehtug","text":"Place the tube strip in a magnetic separation rack until beads separate fully from the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mmun","text":"Slowly pipette off the cleared supernatant without disturbing the beads. It is recommended to save the supernatant in another tube strip in case of poor DNA recovery.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7lv1","text":"Slowly dispense 200 µL, or enough to cover the beads, of freshly prepared 80% ethanol into each tube. After 30 seconds, pipette off the 80% ethanol and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5u3qk","text":" Repeat the previous step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6e8b","text":"Remove residual 80% ethanol: • Remove tube strip from the magnetic separation rack. • Quick spin tube strip in a microcentrifuge. • Place tube strip back in a magnetic separation rack until beads separate fully from the solution. Pipette off residual 80% ethanol and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"amrsi","text":"Remove the tube strip from the magnetic rack. Immediately add 20 µL of elution bufferto each tube and resuspend the beads by pipetting 10 times or until evenly distributed with wide bore tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c61nl","text":"Quick-spin the tube strip in a microcentrifuge to collect liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6cc7v","text":" Leave at room temperature for 5 minutes to elute DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9mlgu","text":" Place the tube strip in a magnetic separation rack until beads separate fully from the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3s0g","text":"Slowly pipette off the cleared supernatant without disturbing the beads. Transfer supernatant to a new 0.5 mL LoBind tube. Discard old tube strip with beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2iqnr","text":"Take a 1 µL aliquot from each tube. Measure DNA concentration with a Qubit fluorometer using the 1x dsDNA HS kit. Calculate the total mass. Recommended: Further dilute each aliquot to 250 pg/µL with Femto Pulse dilution buffer. Measure final SMRTbell library size distribution with a Femto Pulse system.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ssbe","text":"Proceed to SMRT Link Sample Setup to prepare the SMRTbell library for sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36g9q","text":"Store SMRTbell libraries at 4°C if sequencing within the week. Long-term storage should be at -20°C. Minimize freeze-thaw cycles when handling SMRTbell libraries","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: snASE - MAS-Seq protocol
